Description: Marble head from a portrait statue of a man.
Curator's comments: The head was fashioned for insertion into a statue. The back of the head and the neck were added in stucco and are now missing. The coiffure is only roughly carved, detail would have been rendered in stucco. Cain has dated the head into the late Flavian period. Despite its provenance from Roman Egypt, it closely follows metropolitan Roman models.
Bibliographic references: Sculpture / Catalogue of Greek Sculpture in the British Museum (1888)
Exhibition history: Exhibted: October-December 2012, China, Shanghai, China Art Museum, 'Human Form'
